intro: Plagiobothrys bracteatus, commonly known as the bracted sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Plagiobothrys bracteatus thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments.
